Oscars 2017: Dev Patel and Andrew Garfieldâ€™s hot dates? Their beautiful moms Patrick Ryan , USA TODAY 8:42 p.m. ET Feb. 26, 2017 
'Lion' star Dev Patel and mother Anita Patel (Photo: Frazer Harrison, Getty Images) 
Lion 's littlest breakout star Sunny Pawar isn't the only one who stole our hearts on the Oscars red carpet. 
While many nominees opted to bring their significant others and BFFs (hey, Michelle Williams and Busy Phillips!), others agreed that mothers make the best dates. 
Supporting-actor contender Dev Patel, nominated for Lion , arrived with his mom, Anita Patel, in tow. 
Dev Patel, left, flashes a grin with mom Anita Patel. (Photo: Frazer Harrison, Getty Images) 
Manchester by the Sea 's Lucas Hedges, also vying for best supporting actor, got a hug and a smooch from his mom, actress Susan Titman, while snapping pictures on the carpet. 
Lucas Hedges strikes a pose with his mother, actress Susan Titman. (Photo: Paul Buck, EPA) 
And Hamilton virtuoso Lin-Manuel Miranda, a first-time nominee for best original song for How Far I'll Go (from Disney's Moana ), came to the ceremony with his mother, Dr. Luz Towns-Miranda, wearing matching blue ribbons for the American Civil Liberties Union. 
Luz Towns-Miranda, left, and Lin-Manuel Miranda (Photo: Jordan Strauss/Invision/AP) 
Not pictured: Andrew Garfield brought his mom and dad to the Oscars, where he's nominated for best actor for war drama Hacksaw Ridge . Asked by Ryan Seacrest what his mom said to him before the show, Garfield said, "My mum is as cool as a cucumber about all this stuff. #AndrewGarfield says his mum would still love him even if he was a murderer ðŸ˜‚ #AcademyAwards2017 #Oscars #Oscars2017 #HacksawRidge pic.twitter.com/oJvSnar1H8 â€” MostBeautifulMenOrg (@mstbeautifulmen) February 26, 2017 
"She's one of those perfect mothers that would love me if I was a murderer," he continued. "She would bring cookies, home-baked, and she would not look at me any differently. She might go, 'I'm a bit disappointed in you for killing all those people.' " 
Well, you know what they say: There's nothing like a mother's love. Facebook
